content: purl purl the yarn over and the slipped stitch together * repeat from * - * until the end of the round round 2 knit with color 1 slip marker work as following * knit the yarn over and the slipped stitch together make 1 yarn over slip the stitch as if to purl * repeat * - * until the end of the round repeat round 1 and 2 until the work measures 23 26 cm ensure the last round is worked is with color 2 round 1 set-up for decreases continuing knitting in brioche change to 3 5 mm double-pointed needles and distribute the stitches evenly across four needles work the stitches as in round 2 work 20 22 stitches onto each needle the beginning of the round is now between the first and fourth needle now we are marking where to do the decreases working as in round 1 work as following * k9 11 place marker k20 22 place marker k20 22 place marker k20 22 place marker k the rest of the round * 3 decreases step 1 work round 2 with color 1 at the same time decreasing as following * knit until 3 stitches before the marker double_crochet-l slip marker k3 double_crochet-r * repeat from * - * until the end of the round = 16 stitches decreased step 2 work 3 rounds like this round 1 round 2 round 1 no decreases repeat step 1 and 2 until you have 32 24 stitches left finishing cut the yarn leaving a long tail thread the tail through the remaining stitches on the needles pull the yarn tight for a neater finish thread the yarn through only the stitches of color 1 and tighten again secure and weave in all loose ends optional sew in an elastic thread in your cast on and where you want the edge to fold share your creation with me and everyone else by tagging @nanneknitwear or using #nanneknitwear on instagram with love marte this pattern is for personal use only you may not reproduce distribute sell or share this pattern in any form whether in print or digital formats thank you for respecting the hard work and creativity behind the design 4
